p: The first part of the survey focused on general perceptions of climate change. Overall, we found that a majority of respondents are confident that the average temperature on Earth is increasing. These levels of belief in climate change were somewhat similar than that of the general populations of Canada and the U.S. living in the areas covered by our survey [ 84, 87]. As for the general population of both countries [ 40– 42], political view was a very strong predictor of respondents’ general beliefs in climate change.
